ygData.subject: Re: Highpass Quest (spoiler material within)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Or, if you re patient, you can wait for someone else to train the Deputy away...though I m not a fan of such a tactic. I had something similar happen to me
ygData.messageBody:
> From: Lost Child <lostchild@...>
>
> This is what you do. Use your fists, attack 3 to 4 low level critters in
> misty, bring them near the tower. The deputy will come out and HELP you
> kill the critters. Now fire up your selo and run far far away from the
> tower. Wait for the train and the deputy to get there and finish off the
> critters there. Now the deputy will WALK back to the tower. You, on the
> other hand, will RUN back with selo and drum. Attack the little thief, and
> bring him away from the tower to kill. Make sure you don't take him to the
> same path where the deputy is coming back from!!

Or, if you're patient, you can wait for someone else to train the Deputy
away...though I'm not a fan of such a tactic.

I had something similar happen to me at the Ruins in East Commonlands. I
had _just_ gotten done lamenting all but the one undead I wanted to deal
with (all 3 were blue to yellow for me), and someone came up and pulled
the blue away just as I came up. Guess what? I ended up with the yellow
chasing me back to the guards (thank goodness I fire up selo as I'm
running in--never know when a ghoul pops).

Just my 2 copper,

Grei, Bard of the 11th Measure
Bristlebane

p.s. I think Measure sounds better than Octave or Chord--and it's more
fitting too, as each measure helps music grow, just like our levels help
us grow. :)

--

Not all who wander are lost
